intro: Beilschmiedia danhkyi, commonly known as the Danhkyi beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly in regions of Vietnam and Cambodia. This evergreen tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and has smooth, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers followed by edible berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
